analysis.Summary: Vue component that renders a form for viewing or creating an organization. It displays the current organization state, allows selecting a type, editing profile name and description, and submitting the data to create a new organization.
analysis.Purpose: Serves as the Organization Details page in the application, enabling users to configure or create an organization record within the Organizations module.

Components.name: Select
Components.responsibility: Dropdown component for selecting the organization type.

Components.name: Field
Components.responsibility: Input field component used for entering the organization name and description.

Components.name: Button
Components.responsibility: Button component that triggers the form submission.

Components.name: Popup
Components.responsibility: Imported but not currently used; potentially for showing modal dialogs or alerts.

Components.name: Places
Components.responsibility: Imported section component for managing organization location(s), not currently rendered in the template.

Functions.name: onSubmit
Functions.purpose: Asynchronously dispatches the create action to the organization store with the current organization data and the authenticated user ID.

Functions.name: redirectTo
Functions.purpose: Intended callback to navigate the user after successful submission (currently commented out).

analysis.Usage: Likely registered as a route component in the organizations module router. Other parts of the app import it by path (`modules/organizations/components/pages/OrganizationDetails.vue`) to display the organization details/create page.
Notes: The `Popup`, `Places` and `inputsValidation` imports are not used in the template or script logic and may be remnants or placeholders for future features.
The `redirectTo` function's navigation call is commented out, so after submission the user is not automatically redirected.
The `<style>` block is empty except for a placeholder selector `#header`.
The template directly binds to `organization.state.current`, indicating reliance on a global or module-scoped reactive state.
